reviewText: Great movie! DVD quality is great! Great for anyone that wants to learn about the Gracie family and history.
Awesome history of The Gracie family and early Vale Tudo /MMA. Lots of rare early footage highly recomended
Great move for anyone who wants to know about Gracie Jiu Jitsu or those who practice it.

Truly a treasure to have as it is well documented film with various Gracie's giving their own perspective on the internal conflicts of the family & more importantly- why they continue to be a legendary family in the martial art world.
Great for anyone that's interested in the origins of Brazilian jiu jitsu and MMA.

I've been involved in Jiujutsu for 20 years now and I am not into sport or competition Jiujutsu. This is a great history lesson as well as the street view of the real anything goes vale tudo real world application of Jiujutsu meant for self defense and self preservation. Great flick! Seller gets 100% for quick delivery!

I am so happy I found this. It really tells the tale of this legendary martial arts family... from Helio, to Rickson and Rolls (who was the most influential but died early in a hang-gliding accident. If you want the definitive backstory of the this historical Jiu Jitsu dynasty this is for you as there is loads of arrival footage stretching all the way back to the 60s, 70s... the narrator may bore but this is more factual in nature so its acceptable
Excellent documentary about the story of Vale Tudo and the Gracie family.

This was a very good and informational DVD.  Most of what you hear about this subject matter is extremely pleasant and polished (by design).  This DVD explored some of the more painful, sad, and realistic side of family, fame, and dynasty.  Sometimes the language is hard to follow because it constantly flows back and forth between English and Portuguese.  Well worth it if you intend on understanding the nature of BJJ.
